t: Isaiah 29
Jerusalem Is Warned
Woe,*pn O Ariel, Ariel the city where*i David once*i camped! Add*ln year to year, observe your*i feasts on schedule.
I*ln will bring distress to Ariel, And*ln she will be a*i city*i of*i lamenting and mourning; And*ln she will be like an Ariel to me.
I*ln will camp against you encircling you,*i And*ln I will set siegeworks against you, And*ln I will raise up battle towers against you.

Then*ln you will be brought low; From*ln the earth you will speak, And*ln from the dust where*i you are prostrate Your*ln words will*i come.*i Your*ln voice will also be like that of a spirit from the ground, And*ln your speech will whisper from the dust.
But*ln the multitude of your enemies will become like fine dust, And*ln the multitude of the ruthless ones like the chaff which blows away; And*ln it will happen instantly, suddenly.
From*ln the Lord*s of hosts you will be punished with thunder and earthquake and loud noise, With*iln whirlwind and tempest and the flame of a consuming fire.
And*ln the multitude of all the nations who wage war against Ariel, Even*ln all who wage war against her and her stronghold, and who distress her, Will*ln be like a dream, a vision of the night.

It*ln will be as when a hungry man dreams— And*ln behold, he is eating; But*ln when he awakens, his hunger is not satisfied, Or*ln as when a thirsty man dreams— And*ln behold, he is drinking, But*ln when he awakens, behold, he is faint And*ln his thirst is not quenched. Thus*ln the multitude of all the nations will be Who*ln wage war against Mount Zion.
Be*ln delayed and wait, Blind*ln yourselves and be blind; They*ln become drunk, but not with wine, They*ln stagger, but not with strong drink.
For*ln the Lord*s has poured over you a spirit of deep sleep, He*ln has shut your eyes, the prophets; And*ln He has covered your heads, the seers.
The*p entire vision will be to you like the words of a sealed book, which when they give it to the one who is literate, saying, “Please read this,” he will say, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
Then the book will be given to the one who is illiterate, saying, “Please read this.” And he will say, “I cannot read.”

Then*p the Lord said, “Because*pn this people draw near with their words And*ln honor Me with their lip service, But*ln they remove their hearts far from Me, And*ln their reverence for Me consists of tradition learned by*i rote,*i

Therefore*ln behold, I will once again deal marvelously with this people, wondrously marvelous; And*ln the wisdom of their wise men will perish, And*ln the discernment of their discerning men will be concealed.”
Woe*ln to those who deeply hide their plans from the Lord,*s And*ln whose deeds are done*i in a dark place, And*ln they say, “Who sees us?” or “Who knows us?”

You*ln turn things*i around! Shall*ln the potter be considered as equal with the clay, That*ln what is made would say to its maker, “He did not make me”; Or*ln what is formed say to him who formed it, “He has no understanding”?
Blessing after Discipline
Is*pn it not yet just a little while Before*ln Lebanon will be turned into a fertile field, And*ln the fertile field will be considered as a forest?
On*ln that day the deaf will hear words of a book, And*ln out of their*i gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see.
The*ln afflicted also will increase their gladness in the Lord,*s And*ln the needy of mankind will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
For*ln the ruthless will come to an end and the scorner will be finished, Indeed*ln all who are intent on doing evil will be cut off;
Who*ln cause a person to be indicted by a word, And*ln ensnare him who adjudicates at the gate, And*ln defraud the one in the right with meaningless arguments.
Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob*pn shall not now be ashamed, nor shall his face now turn pale;
But*ln when he sees his children, the work of My hands, in his midst, They*ln will sanctify My name; Indeed,*ln they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob And*ln will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
Those*ln who err in mind will know the truth, And*ln those who criticize will accept instruction.
